summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, transmitting a production of discovery materials. The materials include records from Insured Aircraft Title Service and Interlochen, and are governed by a protective order.

events.title: Discovery Production to Maxwell Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel, including aircraft and Interlochen records.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team on November 20, 2021.
The produced materials included records from Insured Aircraft Title Service and records labeled 'Interlochen'.
All produced materials were subject to a protective order dated July 31, 2020, which restricted their dissemination.
The document indicates the government's ongoing discovery obligations in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
